notes.text:
An update for openshift-enterprise-postgresql-apb is now available for Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 3.11.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform is Red Hat's cloud computing
Kubernetes application platform solution designed for on-premise or private cloud deployments.

Security Fix(es):

* openshift/postgresql-apb: /etc/passwd is given incorrect privileges (CVE-2020-1707)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: OpenShift Container Platform 3.11 openshift-enterprise-postgresql-apb security update

full_product_name.name: openshift3/postgresql-apb@sha256:8bca76a41be8443a806e07108ac3b0202af579ae42a74abe7c6dad8f16632cb7_ppc64le as a component of Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 3.11
openshift3/postgresql-apb@sha256:d1858d849bde0202f19e2f466780f62cea2e0f911950348e62647e6fca59f077_amd64 as a component of Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 3.11

cwe.name: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource

notes.text: An insecure modification vulnerability in the /etc/passwd file was found in the container openshift/postgresql-apb. An attacker with access to the container could use this flaw to modify /etc/passwd and escalate their privileges.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2020-1707 openshift/postgresql-apb: /etc/passwd is given incorrect privileges
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: By default this vulnerability is not exploitable in un-privilieged containers running on OpenShift Container Platform. This is because the system call SETUID and SETGID is blocked by the default seccomp policy.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
See the following documentation, which will be updated shortly for release 3.11.188, for important instructions on how to upgrade your cluster and fully apply this asynchronous errata update:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/3.11/release_notes/ocp_3_11_release_notes.html

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2020-1707 openshift/postgresql-apb: /etc/passwd is given incorrect privileges
